Fix plan: (1) Generate per-sprite PNGs into assets/sprites-src (32x32/32x48). (2) Build step stitches sprites into assets/sprites.prod.png via art/layout.json. (3) Emit atlas JSON as usual. (4) Add validation to fail build if any sprite cell is empty/misaligned (alpha/non-empty checks). (5) Remove single-shot generation entirely from production flow.

title: AI Prompt: Live runtime gameplay modding
description:
Goal
- Add an in-game AI prompt that can modify gameplay mechanics while the game is running by applying validated patches to exposed game state + tunable rules.

User stories (examples)
- "Each coin gives me 10x points" → increase coin scoring multiplier immediately.
- "Remove all coins" → despawn/mark collected all coins currently in the level.
- "I want to fly now" → disable gravity or enable a fly ability at runtime.

Implementation direction (recommended)
- Prefer a constrained "modding API" + typed patch operations over arbitrary code execution.
- No VM is required for parameter/rule tweaks; a sandboxed VM (QuickJS/WASM/Realms) is only needed if we later want user-defined scripting.
- Avoid `eval`/arbitrary JS from an agent: it can break invariants, is hard to validate, and is a security footgun.

High-level approach
- Define a public `GameModdingAPI`:
  - `getSnapshot()` → safe, versioned snapshot of state and tunable rules.
  - `applyPatch(patch)` → list of typed operations (e.g., setRule, removeEntities, setPlayerAbility).
  - `resetMods()` / `undoLast()`.
- Add an in-game prompt UI (desktop + mobile) that sends user text to an agent adapter.
- Agent returns patch operations; client validates + applies; UI shows what changed.

Out of scope (v1)
- Letting the agent rewrite source code or execute arbitrary JS.

Acceptance criteria (v1)
- Prompt available in-game (desktop + mobile).
- Supports at least: coin score multiplier, remove all coins, disable gravity / fly.
- Invalid patches are rejected with user-visible errors; game keeps running.
- One action to reset rules back to defaults.

title: Plan: AI prompt runtime modding (tools + state exposure)
description:
Deliverable
- A concrete, implementable plan for the AI prompt + runtime modding layer, including a safe state exposure strategy and issue fanout.

Recommendation
- Start with a constrained, versioned patch/tool API (no VM needed) and explicitly avoid arbitrary JS/eval.
- Only consider a sandboxed scripting VM later if we need user-authored scripts, and still gate mutations through validation.

Proposed execution order
1) mario-ezs.2 — Design: Modding patch schema + safety model
2) mario-ezs.3 — Core: Public game state snapshot + modding API
3) mario-ezs.4 — Game: Make scoring/gravity/entities tunable at runtime
4) mario-ezs.5 — UI: In-game prompt overlay for live mods
5) mario-ezs.6 — Agent: Tool-calling adapter → patch operations
6) mario-ezs.7 — Tests: Runtime mod patching
7) mario-ezs.8 — Docs: AI modding prompt + API

Key decisions
- State exposure model: `getSnapshot()` returns an immutable, versioned view; all mutation happens via `applyPatch()`.
- Patch schema: JSON-serializable ops; validate types/bounds/targets; transactional apply + optional undo.
- v1 supported actions: coin score multiplier, remove all coins, disable gravity / enable flight.

Notes on VM/sandbox
- Not required for v1. Prefer a typed patch API.
- If we ever add scripting, evaluate QuickJS/WASM in a Worker and keep the mutation surface constrained.

title: Design: Modding patch schema + safety model
description:
Define the contract between the agent and the game runtime.

Requirements
- Versioned patch format (JSON-serializable).
- Typed operations with validation and clear errors.
- Consider an undo stack / transactional apply to avoid partial application.

Candidate operations (v1)
- `setRule(path, value)` (e.g., `rules.scoring.coinValue`, `rules.physics.gravityMultiplier`).
- `removeEntities({ kind: 'coin' | 'enemy' | ... })`.
- `setPlayerAbility({ fly: boolean, dash: boolean, ... })`.

Acceptance criteria
- Patch schema documented and examples included for the 3 v1 user stories.
- Validation rules documented (bounds, types, forbidden targets).

title: Core: Public game state snapshot + modding API
description:
Implement a stable runtime API that exposes state safely and applies patches.

Scope
- `getSnapshot()` returns only what the agent needs (player, hud, entities summary, tunable rules).
- `applyPatch(patch)` validates and mutates internal state via controlled code paths.
- Optional: `undoLast()` and `resetMods()`.

Notes
- There is already a debug global (`window.__SUPER_MO__`). Prefer adding a new, versioned surface rather than exposing raw internal references.

title: Game: Make scoring/gravity/entities tunable at runtime
description:
Wire modded rules into gameplay.

Examples
- Coin score value/multiplier should come from rules (not hard-coded).
- Gravity should be a rule (support multiplier=0 for flight).
- Entity removal ops should affect live arrays safely (coins, shards, enemies).

Acceptance criteria
- Demonstrate: coin 10x points, remove all coins, gravity off/fly.

title: UI: In-game prompt overlay for live mods
description:
Add an in-game UI for entering requests and applying results.

Requirements
- Works on desktop + mobile (no keyboard required on mobile).
- Shows: input, last response (what changed / errors), history.
- Includes: apply, undo, reset.

title: Agent: Tool-calling adapter → patch operations
description:
Implement the agent integration boundary.

Approach
- Define a provider interface that returns patch operations (and optional explanation) for a user prompt + snapshot.
- Start with a local stub/rule-based mapper for offline dev.
- Add optional remote LLM provider behind feature flag + API key (future).

Acceptance criteria
- Given the 3 v1 example prompts, returns correct patch operations.

title: Tests: Runtime mod patching
description:
Add automated coverage for the modding layer.

Suggestions
- Unit-test patch validation + apply.
- Playwright: open prompt, apply "remove all coins", verify coins gone; apply gravity=0, verify player stops falling.

title: Docs: AI modding prompt + API
description:
Document the modding surface.

Include
- Patch schema and examples.
- Safety constraints and why we avoid arbitrary code execution.
- How to add new operations/rules.

title: Fix Pixi canvas sizing and responsive resize
description:
After Pixi.js migration, the play area has sizing issues:

1. **Desktop:** Canvas is too small (320x180 instead of scaling up)
2. **Window resize:** Pixi canvas does not resize when window is resized
3. **Mobile landscape:** Canvas should take up full available space

Root cause: Pixi.js Application needs explicit resize handling. The old Canvas 2D relied on CSS scaling, but Pixi manages its own canvas size.

Acceptance criteria:
- Canvas scales to fit viewport while maintaining aspect ratio
- Window resize triggers canvas resize
- Mobile landscape mode uses full screen width
- Works on both desktop and mobile browsers
